name: NPR
text:
Police have arrested and charged a 31-year-old man over a shooting during an attempt by protesters to topple a conquistador statue in New Mexico.

The suspect is a one-time candidate for city council and son of a former sheriff.
https://t.co/KKHrQtkIVU

name: NPR
text:
Archaeologists have found the skeleton of a baby with Down syndrome who died nearly 4,000 years ago — the oldest confirmed case of Down syndrome.
https://t.co/OEmh82Emxa

name: NPR
text:
Sen. Tim Scott gave an emotional speech on the 5-year anniversary of the shooting at Emanuel AME Church — and lambasted a Democratic colleague for referring to his police reform bill as "token" legislation.
https://t.co/zFJccf7KsE

name: NPR
text:
The Justice Department has filed a motion for an emergency restraining order against John Bolton to block the publication of his explosive new memoir — the latest escalation in the legal battle over the book.
https://t.co/tdxLiaLP6z

name: NPR
text:
When slavery ended, the disenfranchisement of African Americans did not — discrimination continued in jobs, housing and education. 

Economist William Darity Jr. offers a roadmap on how to implement reparations to close the racial wealth gap.
https://t.co/AhecjYQhAl

name: NPR
text:
The Atlanta police officer who shot and killed Rayshard Brooks was involved in another controversial police shooting in 2015 — a case that a local judge found so troubling, she's still bothered by it to this day. (@apmreports)
https://t.co/L4jYMRSC6N
